Problem:
Given a complex function \( z(t) = e^{At}x_0 \) where \( A \) is a constant matrix and \( x_0 \) is the initial condition vector in \( \mathbb{C}^n \). Consider applying the transformation by \( h(z) = e^{Bt}z \), where \( B \) is also a constant matrix.

If at time \( t_1 \), an intervention by function \( g(z) = e^{Ct}z \) (where \( C \) is another constant matrix) is applied, will the state \( z(T) \) for \( T > t_1 \) depend solely on \( A \) and not on \( B \) or \( C \)?
Explanation: The intervention modifies the trajectory from \( t_1 \) onwards resulting in \( z(T) = e^{C(T-t_1)}e^{BT_1}e^{AT_1}x_0 \). As all matrices \( A, B, \) and \( C \) are involved in transforming the state, the end state depends on all three matrices.
